instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F (176°C). Add the cottage cheese to a blender and blend until smooth with no large chunks.
In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, salt, and baking soda. Alternatively, sift them together.
In a large bowl, cream together softened butter, brown sugar, and white sugar using a spoon or mixer.
Add vanilla extract and egg; mix until combined.
Add the blended cottage cheese and mix until incorporated.
Stir in chocolate chips, then gradually add the flour mixture until a cookie dough forms.
Using a cookie scoop or spoons, place dough portions onto a lined baking sheet, spacing them about 2 inches apart (about 12 per sheet).
Bake for 10–14 minutes until lightly golden brown.
Cool on the pan for 2–3 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
